partintro.para: Here you will find information about &nation_name; and its major settlments that any individual who lives in or has briefly researched the nation would know. Feel free to use these sections to help build your characters and integrate them into the world.

&nation_name; was founded roughly 450 years ago when crusaders from a temple of Abadar in &meadows_nation; embarked on a mission to colonize the region. They swore a holy oath that the new nation would be an exemplar of civilation and glory for centuries to come. At that moment, they founded the &crusade_org; and dedicated themselves to the cause of sharing this glory with the world. To that end, they established a means of constructing and linking &portals;—magical gates which can be used to travel to and from &nation_name;. Immigrants to the new nation were slow to come at first, but they did arrive. And as they arrived, they founded successful new lives in the bountiful valley of &valley_name;. Word spread, and the population of &nation_name; grew exponentially as people from all over the continent came to investigate this new wonder and found their expectations exceeded. It was not long before the fledling nation became the hub of luxury, trade, and travel that it is today.

chapter.para: In the heart of the valley of &valley_name;, protected by the forboding &mountain_range; to the north and the unfathomable &rift; to the south, &nation_name; echoes with a clarion call of opportunity. Low, rolling hills stretch across the landscape, and lush green forests intermingle with networks of towns and villages. Occasionally, gleaming cities sit at the center of these networks, marking the terrain with intricate webs of roads that connect settlements for miles around. Along the foothills of the &mountain_range;, frontier towns dot still-wild lands carved with snow-melt rivers that descend from the peaks above to empty into &valley_lake;.

The abundance of the valley may provide, but ultimately the people of &nation_name; are its lifeblood. Most citizens live and work in ostensibly simple villages, where they develop arable land and pull forth rich mineral resources from the valley's mines. Their harvests flow inward toward the cities of the nation, where they supply insatiable craftsmen and merchants who give &nation_name; its reputation as an economic and cultural superpower. In return, the inner settlements provide ample public works, education, infrastructure, and other resources that allow the outland residents to specialize and thrive. All the while, brave and resourceful frontiersmen pave the way for others to follow in their footsteps and expand the glory of the nation.
